title: Kanye West assists with Hurricane Dorian relief in the Bahamas with former LA Laker Rick Fox
text:
Regarded as the worst natural disaster in the country's history, Hurricane Dorian struck the Bahamas at the end of August, causing catastrophic damage to the island and its residents.

And TMZ has reported that Kanye West and Rick Fox were spotted together in the island's capitol city assisting in humanitarian relief efforts on Thursday.

The outlet said the duo spoke with government officials to figure out how they could assist in 'rebuilding efforts in communities impacted by the storm.'

Home: Former Los Angeles Laker Fox lived in the Bahamas as a young child, attending Kingsway Academy in Nassau

Former Los Angeles Laker Fox, 50, lived in the Bahamas as a young child, attending Kingsway Academy in Nassau.

He's now the president of the Bahamas Relief Foundation and as such he's been raising money and helping gather supplies to help those in need after the natural disaster, even taking to Instagram to spread the word.

And now, West, 42, is lending a hand.

The duo were seen together at the Baha Mar Resort in Nassau before they reportedly spoke to officials.

Humanitarian relief efforts: Kanye West, 42, and Rick Fox, 50, were spotted together in Nassau, Bahamas assisting in humanitarian relief efforts on Thursday. They were last seen together at Ye's Sunday Service at The Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral on September 29 in New York City (pictured here)

Social media share: As the president of the Bahamas Relief Foundation, Fox has been raising money and helping gather supplies to help those in need after the natural disaster, even taking to Instagram to spread the word

It's unknown how long they've been on the island, but the pair were last seen together at Ye's Sunday Service at The Greater Allen A.M.E. Cathedral last week in New York City.

The relief efforts will come to an end on Saturday, however, as reports are out that West will perform his Sunday Service that afternoon in Salt Lake City, Utah.

According to the venue's Facebook page, the event will again be free and open to the public, taking place at The Gateway Plaza at noon.

Announcement! According to the venue's Facebook page, the event will again be free and open to the public, taking place at The Gateway Plaza at noon

West’s long-delayed album, Jesus is King, failed to drop as scheduled last Sunday and there have been no updates as to a new release date.

The delays are seemingly caused by Kanye's perfectionist tendencies, with sources from his camp telling TMZ that he keeps making 'final' tweaks, subtly changing the tracks every time he listens to the album.

The accompanying documentary about the album is still set to premiere on October 25.
description: Regarded as the worst natural disaster in the country's history, Hurricane Dorian struck the Bahamas at the end of August. And now, Kanye West and Rick Fox are lending a hand.
